intro: Senecio hilarianus, commonly known as the Hilarian's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
